pageContext.description:
An incomplete copper alloy, possible tip from a spear head, of probable Middle Bronze Age dating (1500 BC to 1150 BC).



Around 5% of the spear head is present, consisting only of the possible tip. It is sub triangular in shape, with a circular cross section. Traces of side blades are present to either side.



It measures 25.9 mm in length, 7.6 mm wide (base), 5.0 mm wide (tip) and 6.2 mm thick. It weighs 3.6 g.



The possible spear head is a dark green colour, with an even surface patina. Abrasion, caused by movement whilst within the plough soil, has resulted in a loss of some of the original surface detail.
